website_summaries.verdict: This helpful pet barrier showcases a nearly universal car fit alongside a high-quality construction.
pros: Sides are adjustable to fit almost any vehicle size
Steel wiring guarantees pets stay in place
Thin wires allow dogs to see through barrier
Works extremely well with larger pets
cons: A few buyers found the product was still too small for their larger SUVs

customer_reviews.title: Does not adjust properly
customer_reviews.text: No matter how I adjust it my dog is always able to sneak his head through and starts drooling all over my backseats. Such a disappointment for $50
customer_reviews.author: Ryan L.

customer_reviews.title: The hooks feel really flimsy and like they wouldn't hold up if my dog really pushed ...
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not universal. I bought it for my Subaru CrossTrek because there really aren't that many options out there and it does not fit my car. I eventually found a way to install it only using one of the smaller panels, but it is now less secure and has a hole on one side that my dog can get through until she grows bigger. The hooks feel really flimsy and like they wouldn't hold up if my dog really pushed against them. This product is not worth the cost. The directions are difficult to follow. Do not order it if you have a Subaru or a similarly sized car.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to install and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: No where as easy to install as marketed and did not stay up all of the time. It can fall down during a car ride. Not sturdy for a more aggressive dog. And not easy to remove when you don't want the barrier in the car. You will need a tool with you at all times when you want to bring down your back seats.
customer_reviews.author: bonnie

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality . Does not work and is flimsy . Im
customer_reviews.author: Angie RX

customer_reviews.title: Complete useless to stop animals from getting from the back to ...
customer_reviews.text: Complete useless to stop animals from getting from the back to the front in any type of truck even with dog hammocks to stop them from going under it. The wings are to small and flimsy to stop even medium size dogs and the method of attachment is pathetic with overall flimsy parts.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Barrier works very well in our 2018 Subaru Outback. ...
customer_reviews.text: Barrier works very well in our 2018 Subaru Outback. All parts were in the package and went together smoothly, attaching to the head restraint posts. It leaves the entire floor area of the "wayback" free so our Lab doesn't have to avoid anything, and we have access to the entire space when he is not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Nelson

customer_reviews.title: A++ In my Nissan Xterra!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pet divider I have tried. My dog loves car rides and goes everywhere with me. Nothing worse than stopping at the store after the park and a wet dog sits in your front seat. This is perfect in my Xterra!! Works awesome, fits awesom and I couldn’t be happier! I laid my seats down, put a SUV pet cargo blanket down then installed this.
customer_reviews.author: Shane D

customer_reviews.title: I finally found something that can keep my German Shepherd out of the front seat.
customer_reviews.text: I finally found something that can keep my German Shepherd out of the front seat. It's very strong and durable and holds up to her pawing at it. She's full grown and very strong, so I was worried that nothing would work. I haven't been able to attach the extended sides to it yet because there isn't enough room on the back because of how the latches attach. I'm going to have to attach it on the opposite side to remedy this. Either way, she hasn't squeezed through those small gaps just yet.
customer_reviews.author: Madeline Otterson

customer_reviews.title: This is the Screen You Need
customer_reviews.text: It took about 20 minutes to install and it works great. It stops our 75 lb Labrador from riding in the seats. No tools are needed to install or remove. It comes with instructions, but you really don't need them. We bought this for our Hyundai Santa Fe, but I can see that it would work well in our Honda as well. It is a must for dog and SUV owners.
customer_reviews.author: John Blatz

customer_reviews.title: Only use if back seat head rest adjust up & down
customer_reviews.text: The idea is great. Only thing is it does not work well on a 2014 Honda CRV. The headrest in the back seat are not adjustable so you cannot use the attachments that come with it to install. I ended up using 3 small bungee cords to keep it in place. Was kind of loose but still worked well. I rated 5 stars because I did not feel it was fair to rate the product low simply because of the way my car is made. The idea is great and those of you who have adjustable head rest should not have a problem using this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Fits great in my 2004 4Runner
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in my 2004 4Runner. I use it attached to the two front seat headrests to keep my 2 80pound dogs from getting up to the front seats. Easy install. Sturdy. Looks nice. Does exactly what it's supposed to do. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Buy this! 100% worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy! Easy to install. I debated some of the cheaper options, but after reading a lot of reviews I decided to spend the extra money and get this. Fits perfectly in my 2017 RAV4. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product. I have a 2013 GMC Terrain and it was easily and quickly installed. Definitely a valuable product
customer_reviews.author: Maniaci Clan

customer_reviews.title: Great, and I like it BUT...
customer_reviews.text: My dog has learned to paw at the top of the grate which puts pressure on the mounting hooks and pops them off. I have had to use a couple of zip ties to reinforce. If you DON"T have an escape artist then this will be fine for you. 4 stars because it is a nice item, I can't hate on a product because my dog is a jerk.
customer_reviews.author: DariaG

customer_reviews.title: Holds my Husky back. (2018 4Runner)
customer_reviews.text: Most importantly - it fits in a 2018 Toyota 4Runner. I had been looking to see if anyone with the same truck as me reviewed this product but couldn't find anything, so I figured I would put that out there for the next person. Pros: -Legitimately Rattle Free -You can adjust it so it covers whatever gaps you may have. -Looks kinda cool -Built well enough -My dog doesn't seem to be able to push his way past it Cons: -Depending on your vehicle, this thing might be a complete pain in the a$$ to assemble. I am talking horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simple barrier for pets.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together and install. Keeps my dogs safe and in the rear where they belong. I installed behind the 2nd row of seats. I had already removed the 3rd row seating for more cargo room. Works perfect for the dogs.
customer_reviews.author: orange rider

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: We just bought a new SUV and wanted to keep our dogs from jumping around all over our seats. This is an absolute waste of money and I can’t believe it costs $50 for this garbage. It won’t hook in tightly to our SUV and it could easily fall or be knocked down. Don’t wast your time or money. I spent an hour trying to get it to work...
customer_reviews.author: Alysa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Jeep Cherokee Trailhawk 2014 and this fits perfectly! Wish it was gray or black, but for the money, it works great! The one made for the vehicle is almost 200 bucks...uh no.
customer_reviews.author: nancyntenn

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This installation was definitely a 2 person job but only took my husband and I about 20 minutes. Does well with keeping our 60 lb lab and 70 lb hound mix contained in the back of our 2019 Jeep Compass. Does not prevent the sad stares and piteous crying since the hound mix would prefer to sit in our laps during car rides.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy G

customer_reviews.title: so glad i bought this it keeps everyone save including the dogs!
customer_reviews.text: okay so skeptical as i was that the dogs wouldnt be able to get threw this i bought it against my better judgement. putting it together was a pain! the instructions were really badly worded honestly i had to figure it out myself and when i did, well it worked like it should! It kept my dogs from traveling into the driver seat and bouncing around like they so like to do, which would cause an accident with all the buttons and having to take your eyes off the road. 4 stars for bad wording on the instructions on how to put it together!
customer_reviews.author: Ladydarksky®

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than the previous barrier that used roof to floorboard tension poles! Fits my 2008 Hyundai Tucson just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I had to play with the small end pieces to make them fit in my 2018 Subaru but with a little effort it works like a charm. Kept my 80 pound dog in the back of the car. Her travel kennel doesn't fit back there and I was wondering how to transport her to the vet and groomers. It is easy to see through, in fact I still have it up and will probably keep it there. I had read reviews and decided this was the route to go instead of other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: PJJ

customer_reviews.title: Only works on small dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have two German Shepard’s who think they have drivers licenses. I needed a barrier to keep them in the back seat of my Explorer. This gimmick barrier uses weak plastic pieces that my dogs destroyed, with little difficulty, the first day I installed it. Using the extra plastic hooks I replaced, they broke the that component the first day of the repair. The concept of installation is good but both the instructions and the components are simply inadequate for any animal over 20 pounds. Plus, it is NOT designed to cover the area between the seats and over the center console; which means even a small dog can get under it and into the front seat.
customer_reviews.author: Steven D. Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I drive a 2014 Nissan Rogue. I really like this gate, so much better than the spring rod style. My only complaint was the side panels didn't fit with the given hardware. All was not lost, we easily zip tied the side panels because of the metal material. Solid product.
customer_reviews.author: Nani B.

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the Dogs in place / Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I have two large dogs (60+lbs) and the barrier did its job keeping them in the back of my "truck". I have a Kia Sorrento and secured this product to the back of the head rests. This product was relatively simple to install and was a much better option than the barriers that need to be twisted and pressurized between the ceiling instead of the floor. I originally couldn't find one of those barriers to fit, but this product did the trick!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne A

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a mastiff. He wants to be in the front of the car and move all around - it is very dangerous. When I moved him to the trunk I didn't expect him to belly slide over the seats. I really wanted to take him places without having to keep my arm across the seats, so I bought this. I can use it in the trunk like the seller photo shows or across the driver and the passenger side seats. Works really well. I tried a hammock seat cover first thinking that would keep him in the back, but definitely not.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: I really like this barrier
customer_reviews.text: I really like this barrier. It fit my RAV4 perfectly and keeps the dogs in the cargo area. I transport dogs for rescues sometimes, and this has come in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: stephcarb

customer_reviews.title: It’s garbage
customer_reviews.text: This gate is complete junk. The whole concept behind mounting is flimsy nonsense. The mounting clips don’t fit my head rest posts properly. Even if it did, it’s not wide enough. Dog gets around it. Or better yet right through it. It’s complete crap. Highly recommend not buying it.
customer_reviews.author: joseph

customer_reviews.title: Just perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love it. My dog had a tendency to want to jump into the front seat and is very distracting in the car. With this barrier she’s safely in the back. I’ve had it for over a year now and it hasn’t wavered in the slightest bit. It was easy to install and doesn’t hinder any features of the trunk (Subaru Forester). I suppose if I wanted to fold down the seats I’d have to remove but can’t imagine it would be difficult or take long. In the past year I’ve had to tighten it maybe once or twice as it started chattering a little after many bumpy rides. Would 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: This barrier has been solid and relatively easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I first tried a barrier that was floor to ceiling and my 85lb black lab knocked it over right away without even trying. This barrier has been solid and relatively easy to install. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works but
customer_reviews.text: Bungee cords work more reliably for attaching to the headrests than the supplied plastic hooks, which can bend and pull loose. The hooks work on the headrest poles, and if you have poles, tarp ball tie bungee cords are nice, not having any hooks. I suppose if you don't have headrest poles, a large wrap-around bungee cord is the only option.
customer_reviews.author: rhhardin

customer_reviews.title: It does what it is supposed to do....keep the dogs in the back of the SUV
customer_reviews.text: It is strong which I like. the only problem seems to be that one of our dogs can stick his head through the space between the bottom of the barrier and the side of the car. It seems to loosen the added on piece. Another issue is when we switch drivers....I need to pull the seat up and my husband has to move it back. You have to move both the seats a little at a time so you don't break the metal screen. That proves frustrating when there is only one person there.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy H. McHugh

customer_reviews.title: Great product with qualifications!
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 5 ***** but the directions were very poorly written. After staring at the parts for 5 minutes i took it out to my car and installed it in s about 15 minutes. It is a bit flimsy but I added some zip ties and now it is very solid. My 51 lb pitt/Bassett mix will never go through it or around it. For someone with arthritis trying to install alone i wouldn't recommend this product. I found it painful and difficult at times.
customer_reviews.author: ReedTwanger

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a challenge to install
customer_reviews.text: I like that this works in my car, 2008 Subaru Outback. However, it was a bit difficult to install, even for two people. The black plastic hardware used for securing the main part of the divider to the headrests really don't work well. They are difficult to loosen or to tighten. Just don't seem to be very well constructed for the intended application. We did get it installed and it works well for the intended purpose. I would like one that was easier to relocate, like behind the drivers seat when the extra room is needed, and then put it back behind the back seat when you need to use the back seat. This will work for now.
customer_reviews.author: IVRider

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble, and it WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: I have two Giant Schnauzers, one weighs 95 pounds, the other one weighs almost 110 pounds. I had previously purchased a barrier made out of tubing and it lasted less than one ride in my Jeep. I traded vehicles and have my Granddaughter’s car seat in the rear seat of my new vehicle, and want to make sure Pigpen #1 and Pigpen #2 stay in the cargo area as they are always outside rolling around getting filthy. This barrier is very easy to assemble, it took less than 15 minutes to assemble, and it is very sturdy, it stands up to my two boys.
customer_reviews.author: SchultzsMom1129Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Its good and does the job , could have been better but for what i payed , i have no complaints Just need to be careful , its not heavy duty, any hard push pull with mounting might break them as its plastic, the screen is metal so lot of weight on the hardware Would be better if made from composite or plastic material My dogs dont push pull on it so could have gone for lighter material but for aggressive dogs the screen is well built but can't say that for sure for hardware, lets see , so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Amrit

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality & Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: It broke in less than 24hrs of installing it, my 8 month old puppy was able to get through it to my backseat and chewed through my seatbelt. I emailed the company before writing this review about sending me a replacement part but never received a response. Poor quality, difficult to install and very poor customer service. I would definitely not recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Creasia

customer_reviews.title: Read instructions thoroughly before tackling this—it’ll save you some grief.
customer_reviews.text: We put this barrier together in about 20 minutes, although the instructions were not as clear as they could’ve been. Fits my new 2019 Subaru Forester very well. Snug fit, no rattles. My 60 pound lab mix and 30 pound terrier are pretty easygoing, so they didn’t try to fight it, but I suspect a large aggressive dog could probably do some damage to it (i.e. chewing knobs). We humans like it very much, but the dogs are miffed because they can no longer shove their snouts in our ears as we’re going down the road.
customer_reviews.author: E. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The large screws will rub against the seats and cause holes if turned toward the inside of the car, etc. (seats, etc.) or can cause injury to pet if turned toward the back of the car. Had to wrap tape around the screws several times to protect my dog from being injured. The screws ends, etc. are very sharp. Had to keep adjusting more than once during the duration of the drive to keep in place. Once arrived at destination took out of the vehicle and it fell apart. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Returned this - too hard to install
customer_reviews.text: Spent more than an hour trying to put this in my car - was picturing easy placement - so it could be put in and out as needed. After working at it that long, decided to return it since it would not be something that could be put in and out. Did not seem like it would be sturdy either - and I had the sense that it would "rattle" in the back of my car... though I did not drive with it, so cannot say for certain.
customer_reviews.author: VJB

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation
customer_reviews.text: I liked this pet barrier because it is easy to install and it very sturdy. I have two very large dogs who like to travel with me, but one fast braking sent one of them to the front seat wondering "what the heck just happened." When I bought a new car, I wanted something that protect them and also protect me should the unthinkable happen. It can also be removed easily for when we travel without the pups!!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: received old model with straps
customer_reviews.text: One person cannot install this thing and the straps are ridiculous. It took me on my own about 30 minutes to figure out how to appropriatey size the main and side panels and get them fitted together. The straps? When I cam back to look at amazon to see if there was an installation video i saw that the model I bought must be an older version because it has different attachment mechanisms. I m returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Archetypehealer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit Pilot
customer_reviews.text: Had to return b/c it didn't work as a barrier btwn cargo and rear seats on '13 Pilot. Product was fine & arrived undamaged but rear seats are reclined slightly for child seats and the anchoring system isn't conducive to the angle. The metal grates were well made and the anchoring simple, but I'm skeptical it would've kept a 90lb Akita mix from breaking through. It would probably be fine for a well behaved or slightly smaller dog.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus

customer_reviews.title: GET ZIP TIES BEFOREHAND !!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Get zip ties as an added fastener. Just the lock pieces themselves are not enough to get a great fit. After a little adjusting and 10 zip ties, it is sturdy. So, really, of you plan on installing and removing frequently, this isn't the product you want. If you're like me and only plan on using it every so often, then it's good to get this. It did take 2 people to put together, in order to hold it in place. Once the lock pieces were in, only one person is needed to add the zip ties.
customer_reviews.author: 2 Crazy Large Pups

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and Good, Generic, Fit. Plastic Mounting Hardware is Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a 2002 Toyota 4Runner. Fits well. Small gaps around the edges when installed in it's most expanded position but not enough to matter. My dog can't even get her paw through the gap. Only complaint is the mounting hardware is plastic. If you have a dog who like to chew on things, don't expect these parts to last very long. My dog is a chewer and she's destroyed the knobs you use to tighten the hooks to the headrests. It still stays on fine but I'll have a really hard time taking them off if I ever need to.
customer_reviews.author: Ted W.

customer_reviews.title: Quite flimsy and overpriced but does the job
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my RAV4 to keep my 40lb Siberian Husky from jumping into the back seat. I will say that it does its job but for the price you are paying the barrier is way too flimsy. Its easily shakeable as the barrier has some weight to it but its essentially just being held down by 2 plastic hooks. If your dog is well behaved and won't try too hard to knock down the barrier this will work but if you have a dog who might mess with it, I don't think it will hold up. Overall this product is definitely not worth the price tag but I don't see many alternatives either.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lime

customer_reviews.title: Mounting hooks are junk, customer service address is no good.
customer_reviews.text: The frame and wire mesh seem well enough made, but the main mounting hooks are total junk. One of the two smaller hooks broke on installation and I find no way to order replacements. I would send it back but I broke it during installation, so my fault. I ended up having to use heavy duty zip ties to mount the pet barrier. The web address on the included instruction sheet does not list this pet barrier. I do not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Ed R.

customer_reviews.title: Works great but took a while to set up
customer_reviews.text: Works great but took a while to set up. The pieces used to connect to head rest are a small and large size. The large was way too long for my 2013 Chevrolet Equinox. The small set didn't connect easily and we have to wrestle with the parts and head rest to squish everything together. I'm happy about this for the price and my Belgian Malinois hasn't been able to wiggle his way into the back seat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.  Terrible design.
customer_reviews.text: My dogs got thru it within 5 minutes without any effort on their part both times I have used it. This gate is secured to the headrest, so it has absolutely no staying power. The main locks are so big that you are extremely limited where you can place the additional side panels in your vehicle. Save your money and take a hard pass on this piece of dog poo.
customer_reviews.author: progomphus

customer_reviews.title: As th info said it is easy to install
customer_reviews.text: As th info said it is easy to install, but I'm using the longest hook but once you get it hooked, it takes forever to get it tightens. I'm going to play around with it, even embellish it maybe an option!
customer_reviews.author: Harold C still Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Ok purchase
customer_reviews.text: This product is just middle of the road for me. I would imagine it will last us 6months or so. Maybe a year. It is cumbersome to assemble and the hardware is anything but sturdy. The caps for the tightening hardware fell off instantly, so now I use a pair of pliers for tightening. I'm not sure how much complaining I can do because of the price compared to other barriers on the market.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Very well made and easy to install product!
customer_reviews.text: Very well made and easy to install product! 15 minutes from unboxing to fully installed. Great design and customizable to most vehicles. Looks like a custom product for our 2016 RAV4. This will help eliminate hair in the car and contain the dirt and mud from our dog hikes to the cargo area.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaBrad

customer_reviews.title: For The Price - Great Product - Easy Install - Bought for 2011 Xterra
customer_reviews.text: Much cheaper than all the other options and works perfect fine. Our smaller dog managed to get through the side (shes about 20lbs), but I could probably adjust it to correct. Perfect for a larger dog. Could be a bit more sturdy, but as long as your dog isn't a nut job, you'll be fine. haha.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Anderson

customer_reviews.title: This one keeps your dog in the back.
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th dog barrier I've tried - and this one worked. My puppy is VERY large and he pushed his head and paws through the barriers that have bars going across. This one has small openings and it hooks to the headrests of the back seat. So far it seems very sturdy and I would recommend buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy but not easy to just pop in/out
customer_reviews.text: The metal parts are great. Plastic parts are cheap, ugly and ungainly to install. I was able to do it alone but I don’t recommend doing so. Although I imagine couples putting this together will get in fights. It’s that kind of frustrating. It works just fine and doesn’t fall off. It’s just not something I like to pop off and pop back on. Takes me about 10 minutes to take it out and 20-30 to put it back in and that’s with practice.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Armer

customer_reviews.title: great divider
customer_reviews.text: Works and I didn't have to install the side pieces. My 50 lb Pit Bull Puppy responds to the barricade and doesn't even try to come through BUT since he still is a chewer, he went after the big plastic screws thingys that hold the screen to your head rest....but if he does it again, I'll slather them with BITTER YUCK, so they won't taste good!
customer_reviews.author: kitch-n-Things

customer_reviews.title: not what I had hoped
customer_reviews.text: Getting it together was easy enough, but mounting it on the back of the head rests was difficult, as the knobs to tighten seemed unnecessarily hard to turn, and the instability of the fencing only made this more difficult. Never really got past that before returning it. Seems the better option would be to get one that goes from the floor to the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Glock

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: It a sturdy one and I like that it is adjustable. Only thing that would make it a little better is to have something that can help clip things in place while you were trying to install, and if it had a little pool noodle type foam thing that could go around edges/corners to keep it from scratching the car. Otherwise it is a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin

customer_reviews.title: A gate
customer_reviews.text: Works well. My husband installed and said it was easy - I am a little nervous to take it out after he sort of showed me what to do. Sounds hard - hope not though because I don’t plan on keeping this in my car full-time. I just want to be able to put it in and out easily as needed. Fingers crossed it is as easy for me as it was for him.
customer_reviews.author: Amy H

customer_reviews.title: Just not the right fit
customer_reviews.text: Is incredibly difficult to attach and doesn’t exactly fit the entire back area. My dog can literally fit his face through one side, even though we measured the area before purchasing to ensure a good fit. We still use it but have to make sure someone is sitting in the backseat to make sure our dog doesn’t get his head through and hurt himself. I drive a 2015 Ford Explorer.
customer_reviews.author: Dewey

customer_reviews.title: 2018 Mazda CX-5
customer_reviews.text: This MOSTLY fits. I couldn't install it alone, as even the short bolts seem almost too long for my headrests. My dog isn't super pushy, so the barrier itself holds him, but it doesn't go ALL the way across and it doesn't support the two side panels, so if he had a smaller block head or was pushier, I am not sure it would do the trick. It does, however, so I am keeping it. Decent quality for the price. I didn't want the $500 grate from the dealership.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had the potential but screwed up my shipping and parts sent
customer_reviews.text: Had ordered it last minute to go on a road trip and install it. It came just in time and the morning of the trip, as I unpacked to instal. Middle frame bent. Probably from poor packaging. The big screw missing. Two small hooks missing although it was supposed to be with the package. Specifically item D in their packaging list. Whilst, this definitely looks sturdy and good for the cause - was thoroughly disappointed with the shipment and quality of products sent and without any due care that resulted in me scrambling to create a makeshift barrier for my dog. Low rating mainly due to quality of shipping. And inability to install.
customer_reviews.author: Shab K.

customer_reviews.title: Fit well and stayed up the entire trip
customer_reviews.text: This is just what we needed. I was a little worried that it wouldn't hold up but it did for 600 miles of interstate driving. Now our dog can finally stop annoying us with his loving but hot and stinky breath and drool! For extra large SUVs it might not fit 100% width-wise, but it still worked fine as there's enough on each side to block our dog's face.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: We set it up to take our dog on long trips and it works wonders. It took a little bit of set up to actually position it correctly in the car, but after that, it works like a charm. Highly recommend for owners who have dogs that jump over seats. It does use the seat heads as a brace but we never have any problems with that either. if you are looking for an affordable way to keep dogs in the back, try this thing out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lets go puppy!
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! I previously had a product that was much more expensive that was awful. My dog could get around it and it wouldn't stay upright. This barrier has 2 lengths for attaching the barrier and is very easy to install. I highly recommend for happier and safer travels with you furry babies
customer_reviews.author: Patrice Gorichanaz

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult to install!
customer_reviews.text: It took me over An hour to install this in my car. The long hooks that connects the barrier to the seat backs were too long and the short ones barely work and Only when used in the middle. I would have returned this product but I destroyed the box trying to make a shiv to get the longer attachment to work. There is still a pretty big space between the barrier and the left and right sides which concerns me about my dogs head getting stuck. I’m going to try and block it with something to prevent this from happening
customer_reviews.author: C.D

customer_reviews.title: Barrier did not come with attachments shown online
customer_reviews.text: Product did not come with the attachment shown in the photos online. Instead of the “quick connectors” shown and described the barrier came with straps that simply go around the headrests. While this does work it made the barrier more difficult to install and is not what I expected. However for $40 I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: returning
customer_reviews.text: returning this as it didn't come close to fitting my 2016 2500 Ram. If your seats tilt back, then you're not going to get this gate to sit flush with them. :-(
customer_reviews.author: K. King

customer_reviews.title: I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t rattle and installation was super easy. It’s sturdy and durable. I installed it on my 2 door JK 07. Don’t plan on adjusting your seat after installing it bc they install to the back of your seat head rest.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2015 Subaru Forester and it most definitely does not fit the back area of my car. Even the short hook is too long and creates too much of a gap to allow a tight fit. Very disappointed. I would return it but it’ll be more of a hassle than it’s worth. Too bad because I really wanted this to work. So it goes.
customer_reviews.author: DAdams87

customer_reviews.title: Does The Job For Ford Focus Hatchback
customer_reviews.text: I only used the main section to address my needs so no first hand info on the wing parts installation or use but it is surely easy enough. The main section gives ample coverage and was easy to install to the headrest post of the front seats and works great as a deterrent for the new dog to try driving or change the radio station.
customer_reviews.author: Snodoc

customer_reviews.title: Not up to a determined dog
customer_reviews.text: This worked for about two weeks, which was the time it took for my very determined dog to figure out how to get under it. I adjusted the height, and he got over it. I put one of the side rectangles in the middle bottom, and he went around it. Sigh. As a psychological barrier for many dogs, it would be great. Note to manufacturer: after my first adjustment, I began to use Gear Ties (rubber-coated wires) to attach it to the seat. Worked great, and MUCH more user-friendly than that horrible plastic clamp you currently provide.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in an accident!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and our puppy were hit by a distracted driver doing 60kms/hr. Our vehicle flipped and was completely totalled. Fortunately neither were injured and this barrier was completely undamaged too!!! Not bad!!
customer_reviews.author: Khowie

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The barrier does a good job of keeping my 60# Border Collie/Lab in the rear area of my SUV. It's relatively sturdy and much easier to install than full-height barriers I've dealt with in the past. Since it uses the rear headrest supports my rear seats can't be folded down without removing the barrier but I knew that when I purchased it. Having the dog in the back - and not the backseat - was a necessary trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey W. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Not for large smart dogs
customer_reviews.text: Does not fit a Subaru Outback. Bigger dogs wanting into the front can easily bend the two side panels making their heads fit nicely. With determination dogs can break the 2 brackets once the wedge between the window and car seat. We used 8 zip ties to make the sides extend how we needed them to in order for them to reach the windows leaving no gaps.
customer_reviews.author: MSternberg001

customer_reviews.title: Barrier for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: The barrier seems very nice durable, however it doesn't fit properly in my SUV. I did a lot of research and read a lot of reviews and thought it would fit in my 2014 Jeep Compass but it doesn't fit so that you can confine the dogs to the trunk unless you rig it with some bunge cords, it does fit a little better if you confine the dogs from the front seat so that they would be in the back seat. If it would have fit better it would have been perfect ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Adriana

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit 4dr Jeep Sahara JK not wide enough and interferes with seatbelt
customer_reviews.text: Would have been a decent purchase except for design doesnt allow you to utilize the full length of the side barriers, my dog squeezed through, had to make my own extensions. Would work good on a smaller SUV or crossover.
customer_reviews.author: heather stites

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable and easy install
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I was able to install the pet barrier in our 2016 Acura MDX all by myself. The only thing I couldn't figure out was how to remove/replace the hooks with the alternates provided. Fortunately the ones that came already assembled were just fine. I've noticed it rattles just a little bit - I may add some felt between the parts to give it a little cushion. Overall, I'm really pleased, and so glad you can customize the shape to meet your needs.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline Alcalde

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and also to remove when needed. Keeps my dogs separated so they don’t fight in the car. Would recommend
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Super helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install, took me about 15 minutes and you don't need any tools. Keeps my 70 lb Golden Lab in the back. Decent quality and fits in my 2007 Subaru Forester! So nice to keep my dog in the back from now on, and is much safer for all of us in the car.
customer_reviews.author: A. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and love the price!
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in my 2011 Nissan Juke. Does exactly what it says it does- keeps my dogs in the back and less hair in the seats of my car. I like that it can be configured so many ways that no matter what car I ever have that it will be sure to fit. I added some foam padded tape to the edges on top that just barely touched the window so it wouldn’t rattle.
customer_reviews.author: morgan a.

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to set up or dismantle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 2016 Nissan Rouge to prevent my dogs from coming up in the front while I'm driving. Putting it together was not very easy due to the instructions not being clear on how to assemble it...I struggled. I decided to return the product as it did not fit my vehicle well. When I attempted to dismantle it, I again struggled and ended up needing to use pliers to get it off because it broke while trying to release it.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel Keller

customer_reviews.title: Attractive and sturdy. Not easily put up and down
customer_reviews.text: The price and look of this gate is nice. It was time-consuming installing it without help. 2 people installing would make it a breeze. I wish it could be easily detached on each side independently and together as I sometimes need to fold my SUV back seats down and it would take some effort to do that with this gate.
customer_reviews.author: K Stine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for certain vehicles. We have a 2014 ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work for certain vehicles. We have a 2014 GMC Acadia and I cannot get this to fasten tightly to the headrests. Also, if your seat that you are attaching this to isn't a full bench seat, there will be a large gap that the gate doesn't cover. Our SUV has no middle seat in the second row, so there is a very large area that this gate does not cover. Carefully look into the dimensions of the gate and of the area that you need sealed off before you purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Buckham

customer_reviews.title: Recommended definitely!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Keeps my 2 large German Shepherd's in the back seat, finally!! I love it, dogs don't 😂 I can drive without worrying about them jumping all over the front seat! Made well enough to hold a 100lb also a 90lb German Shepherd back.🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟 I have this installed in a 2017 Chevy Cruze!! Perfect!!
customer_reviews.author: K.addicted.to.amazon.

customer_reviews.title: Worked for our two Samoyeds in our Prius V
customer_reviews.text: We drive long distance with two Samoyeds. One of them liked to climb into the front seat. Now the dogs get the rear and luggage goes in the middle. We put cushions in the back and clipped two DC car fans which plug into the “lighter” power source. The hooks attached well to the headrests and hold well. The pups can stick therapists heads through the edges but not their bodies.
customer_reviews.author: J. Traynor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 2018 Forester
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Arrived promptly. Works great in 2018 Subaru Forester. We use it without wings but can see that they would give you more full coferage. Easy on and off by popping off headrests.
customer_reviews.author: Olywa

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Mazda CX-5
customer_reviews.text: Put this in the very back of a 2016 Mazda CX-5. Worked perfectly. Dogs stay in the back and don't jump around in the car. A big dog bed in the back and they are pleased as well. Our dogs like to escape anything like this, but this one is holding strong. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: My husband put this in my car, he was able to mostly do it alone but I helped a bit just to make things go faster. My dog isn't a total fan but it does exactly what I need it to. I have an almost 2 year old golden retriever and she has not destroyed or tried to get past this gate.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsy

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Put this in my '11 Honda Pilot LX. Excellent fit. No concerns of this shifting or coming loose. Try as they might, the dogs have lost to this one.
customer_reviews.author: MasonM

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: This was simple to install in the back of our 2018 Mazda CX-5. In this vehicle you don’t really need the side pieces, which makes the install much cleaner and easier. Our German Shepherd can’t fit his giant melon through the gaps on the side.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Fits our Honda Pilot
customer_reviews.text: We installed this yesterday and took our first ride. We have a 100 lb Rhodesian Ridgeback who likes to jump the seats and be in control. This stopped him completely. He did not try to claw out through the barrier. So far, so good! We like it a lot, are more relaxed and feel safer with the dog contained in the back. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: LucyTweet

customer_reviews.title: I liked the price compared to the specific Jeep Wrangler application that was 3x the cost.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to install. I had to use both panels on one side for my application (Wrangler JKU) and requested two more panels for the other side. Been over a week now and haven’t heard from the company on obtaining the requested additional panels.
customer_reviews.author: John Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: annoying to install
customer_reviews.text: In theory it's a great product. I have an Acura RDX and couldn't get it to install. It was awfully difficult. I wanted something with an installation method like this where there's nothing hitting the roof of my car potentialy ripping the soft material however I couldn't get it to work. Overall the width and stuff was great but it was hard to get the hooks to attach to the seats head rests and keeping them in place it ended up sticking out on an angle. Boo.
customer_reviews.author: Skirmante

customer_reviews.title: Fits Grand Cherokee
customer_reviews.text: It fits my jeep Grand Cherokee perfectly. Just right. The rear headrests do not adjust but it is easy to feed the hooks under the headrests to attach to the headrest supports. I have 2 70lb dogs and it secures them both in the back. I also can fit it in my Durango. Those headrests also do not adjust. it is really good quality and does not rattle at all. The only thing I worry about is breaking the plastic clips. Would have preferred aluminum in the same form factor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: some of the worst installation instructions I have ever had and NO PICTURE ...
customer_reviews.text: some of the worst installation instructions I have ever had and NO PICTURE that looks like the one in this review which would have been helpful. I cant review the product and its effectiveness because I now can try AGAIN to install the darn thing.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Spivey

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Fastening device is all plastic and very flimsy. Will not remain snug. Zip ties would be an improvement. Certainly not a good product for an Xterra. Also, since it straps to your headrest, passengers cannot adjust their seats without damaging this product.
customer_reviews.author: MarcusHoward

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, but be sure to get a helper for teh installation.
customer_reviews.text: It will not take long to adjust it to the needs/specifications of your particular vehicle, but be sure to get someone else to sit in the seat ahead to hold it and to assist in fishing the straps through the mesh. Adding the helper makes the whole process easy.
customer_reviews.author: WSL

customer_reviews.title: The dogs are "safely" contained while I drive down the road.
customer_reviews.text: Love this barrier! Fits my 07 Honda Ridgeline Crew Cab backsest perfect! The old one was tearing down the headliner from the pressure. Love this one because the tension is on the headrest and the backseat grab bars...both much more durable than the headliner. It took some rigging and small bungee cords but does the trick! The 95# Shepard and his 65# sister desperately wanted to drive and there is a reason they dont give dogs licenses.... I'm thinking of maybe getting another one to do in a downward position to keep the console hole blocked but the hammock seat cover is working fine for now.
customer_reviews.author: shopper girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my Lexus RX. I didn’t use the side panels because my dog is too big to get through the sides. He can stick his head through the side since there’s a bit of space there. He now cant get out of the cargo area . He was getting mud on my seats when he used to jump over the back seat. I’m happy. He is sad.
customer_reviews.author: Brady's mom

product_meta.title: Dog Barrier for SUV's, Cars & Vehicles, Heavy-Duty - Adjustable Pet Barrier, Universal Fit
product_meta.description: Jumbl Pet Barrier is designed to safely keep your pets from going from the cargo area to the drivers and passengers seat, creating a more comfortable and safer haven for the driver, passengers and pets alike. Constructed out of heavy duty material, this adjustable pet barrier virtually fits in any wagon or SUV by attaching to the headrest easily without any tool necessary. The protective brace pads will not damage the vehicles interior and the see through design eliminates blind spots.
feature_bullets: Keeps Pet safe in the cargo area of Vehicle, Safely Away From Driver & Passengers
Universal fit - Fully Adjustable to Accommodate Most cars, SUVs, hatchbacks
Main Panel Measures L 35.5" H16.5, the adjustable side panels are L12" and H10.5, Please see the second image for more details
Made of the highest quality Steel wire construction, Easy to install and remove - NO tools required
100% SATISFACTION GUARANTEED – Your Purchase Is Covered By A Lifetime Warranty and Backed By 'Jumbl Pets’ Exceptional Quality & Service

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
